With its 525 thousand population Ryazan is the 3rd largest city in
. Neither the size nor the proximity to
(200 km) helps to upgrade the city's image:

is totally provincial.

As an industrial center and a transport hub,
is not a major tourist destination. But its history and several attractions make the city a good solution for a weekend escape from

. 

The city was founded in 1095 AD, but its initial site was completely destroyed by Mongols in 1237 -
was the first obstacle on their way of conquering
was built few dozen kilometers away from the destroyed site.
doesn't operate regular flights and is being used for small aircraft and training. So, the closest air terminals are
. From those airports Ryazan can be accessed by train, by bus, or by car/taxi.

Ryazan is an important transit rail hub. There are 2 train terminals in the city (Ryazan-1 and Ryazan-2). Most trains proceed to the east and arrive at the larger Ryazan-1 terminal, while those going to the south stop at Ryazan-2.

An ordinary ride by

(Казанский вокзал) takes almost 4 hours and costs 320 RUR (one way). 

A faster and more comfortable option is to take an express train from the same terminal. The ride takes a little less than 3 hours, the cost depends on the class of the car. There are 3 express trains daily, going in the early morning, midday and evening.

Except
is also a major stop for many long-distance trains going from
(Выхино) metro station. The buses leave 1-2 times per hour starting from 6-30 AM to 7-30 PM. The price is comparable with
, or even cheaper. Other destinations accessible by bus from
is located out of the city center, so you will probably need to get around by local bus, trolleybus, or a taxi. There is also the second and less-importnant
terminal, serving bus routes to suburbs, e.g.
by M5 federal road. As elsewhere in
, the road conditions differ greatly from a 4-lines highway to narrow bottle-necks with usual traffic-jams. Depending on traffic situation the way from

may take from 2 to 6 hours (beware Friday evenings and Saturday mornings in the summer).

Being unhurried, you may visit on your way to
expect to pay 3,000 - 4,000 RUR for one-way journey and use only certified providers.
You can get around the city by taking a minibus, a taxi or a bus. The public transport system is represented by ancient trolleybuses which are pretty slow.

value: Cathedral of the Assumption in the kremlin of Ryazan
price=free access to the territory, charge 50-100 RUR for the entrance to museum exhibitions

content=The city's major architectural attraction with a number of old churches and a very beautiful cathedral. Kremlin is located at a high river bank, and you can enjoy an amazing view from it. The city center here changes into the rural floodplain of the Oka river. There are several museums and exhibitions inside the kremlin, you can also buy local souvenirs there.
content=The museum of a famous Russian physiologist, Nobel-prize winner
content=Good collection in an old beautiful building. A lot of good paintings, not typical for regional museums in Russia.

Take a 3-hour boat trip from the Kremlin embarkment along Oka-river and back. With Russian pop-music and spontaneous dances on the top deck. 

Visit bee and honey museum and horse-breeding institute in Rybnoe.

value: content=The largest hotel in the city, but a bit out of the center. Next door to Ryazan-2 train station. Renovated in 2005. wi-fi. Staff may be expected to speak some English.
content=Cosy small hotel right next to the Kremlin on a quiet street in the center. Bar and billiards on the 1st floor. Staff may be expected to speak English.

"New Russian" hotels http://www.monarx-ryazan.ru/ 50-180$ and http://www.atlantic-club.ru/hotel/ 60-100$- in the center.
, a famous Russian poet. Great views of Oka river and beautiful rural scenery. About 50 km from Ryazan via the town of Rybnoe.
